page.title: 01THE LOWER TEST VALLEY:REVIEW
page.content: The area lies immediately to the north west of Southampton and south of Romsey in the lower part of the Test valley.It forms part of the Hampshire Basin,and is a pleasant rural area with low wooded hills. It is a rural landscape,formed from the floodplain of the river Test:Pages 2-3.The farming is mainly mixed with both arable and dairying:Pages 4-8. There is some glasshouse cultivation, Pages 9-12. There is a very low population density in the area and only Page 13 is devoted to this.The only village, Wigley, contains an old inn which has been converted into a hotel for local guests and tourists:Pages 14-15. Gravel quarrying is the only industry:Pages 16-17.Traffic improvements in the area have led to the building of the M27:Pages 18-19.
